dict.string: Style 1 used OpenGL lines and points. It is suitable for 2D work. Style 2 is a faster display, also suitable for 2D. Style 3 draw real tubes and uses OpenGL lighting for rendering. It is nice for 3D.
This is only useful if the main Space is periodic, strip or cylinderP. In this case, the whole system will be displayed multiple times, shifted appropriately in the directions that are periodic.
if true, translate objects to place them in the root cell for periodic boundary conditions

if set > 0, this defines the unit size used for `point_size` and `line_width`. `point_size` and `line_width` are usually set in pixels, but if `point_value` is set, these specifications are interpreted as multiples of `point_value`, which itself is given in simulation unit (i.e. real distance). For example, if you set `line_width=5` and `point_value=0.01`, the fibers will be displayed with a diameter of 0.050 (i.e. 50 nanometers).
